Steps to add ZSDK_ANDROID_API.jar to your Android Studio project

  1. Open your Android® project
  2. Open the Project Tool Window
  3. Switch the Project Tool Window into "Project" view using the provided drop-down menu
  4. Navigate to the "app/libs" folder under your application
  5. Copy and Paste all the files from your [Install Dir]/android/[build version]/lib directory into the libs directory of the Android project. (where [Install Dir] is the directory chosen during the installation process, and [build version] corresponds to the desired build)
  6. Select the imported libraries, right click and select "Add As Library..."
  7. Select the appropriate module, and click the OK button
  8. Open the "build.gradle" file for the application module
  9. Under the "android" item, add the following statements:
      packagingOptions {
        exclude 'META-INF/LICENSE.txt'
        exclude 'META-INF/NOTICE.txt'
        exclude 'META-INF/NOTICE'
        exclude 'META-INF/LICENSE'
        exclude 'META-INF/DEPENDENCIES'
      }
